DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to investigate if aerobic exercise during and after neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy (NACRT) can improve outcomes for rectal cancer patients. Rectal cancer patients will be randomly assigned to aerobic exercise or usual care. Patients in the aerobic exercise group will be asked to complete 3 supervised high-intensity aerobic interval training (HIT) session/week during NACRT and â‰¥ 150 minutes/week of unsupervised aerobic exercise after NACRT. Primary hypothesis: aerobic exercise during and after NACRT, compare to usual care, will result in significantly better cardiorespiratory fitness.
DOC.brief_title: Exercise During and After Neoadjuvant Rectal Cancer Treatment
DOC.criteria: All patients scheduled to receive longcourse (56 weeks) of NACRT followed by total mesorectal excision Unable to consent Unable to perform aerobic exercise Intention to engage in a structured exercise program during NACRT and/or after NACRT and prior to surgery
